title: **Day 0: plating cells**
body: One day before transfection, plate 6×105 293T cells in 2 ml of growth medium \(DMEM+10%FBS) without antibiotics in 6-well plates \(BD corning) so that they will be 80% confluent at the time of transfection.

title: **Day 1: transient transfection**
body: For each transfection sample, prepare complexes as follows

body.body: Dilute 4 ug plasmid DNA in 250 μl of Opti-MEM®. Mix gently. Plasmid DNA mixture includes 1.3 ug of plasmid containing plasmids expressing sgRNAs against gene-specific targeting sequenceDNA sequence of interest or an control plasmid targeting AAVS1; and 2.6 ug of plasmid containing dCas9-AID P182X \(MO91-dCas9-AIDx)x, Cas9 or dCas9. For experiments requiring inhibiting UNG activity, transfection requiring a second component\(pcDNA3 Ugi), 100 ng of plasmid containing Ugi that component \(pcDNA3 Ugi) or empty vector\(pcDNA3) was also transfected.
Mix Lipofectamine 2000 gently before use, then dilute 10 ul in 250 μl of Opti-MEM®. Incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
After 5 minute5-minute incubation, combine the diluted DNA with diluted Lipofectamine 2000. Mix gently and incubate for 30 minutes at room temperature.
Add the 500 μl of complexes to a well containing cells and medium. Mix gently by rocking the plate back and forth.
Incubate cells at 37°C in a CO2 incubator for 24 hours.

title: **Day 2: drug selection**
body: 24 hours after the transient transfection, passage the cells and add puromycin and blasticidin to select for transfected cells. .

body.body: Wash cells once with 1 ml PBS to remove excess medium and serum.
Add 0.3 ml of 0.25% Trypsin-EDTA trypsin/versene \(EDTA) solution to the monolayer and incubate 1 minute at room temperature until the cells detach.
Add 1 ml of complete medium to stop trypsinization.
Transfer cells to a 1.5 ml EP tube and cCentrifuge at 1000 rpm for 5 min at room temperature to pellet the cells.
Remove the supernatant, re-suspend cells in complete medium.
Divided the cells into two wells in a 6-well plate.
Add 2 ug/ml puromycin and 20ug/ml blasticidin to select for transfected cells.
Move the plate back and forth to plate the cells and the drugs evenly.
Change the medium withReplenish the cells with the fresh medium.
Add 1 ug/ml puromycin and 10ug/ml blasticidin to maintain the selection.

Mix gently by rocking the plate back and forth.

Wash cells once with 1 ml PBS to remove excess medium and serum.
Add 0.3 ml of 0.25% Trypsin-EDTAtrypsin/versene \(EDTA) solution to the monolayer and incubate 1 minute at room temperature until cells detach.

Remove the supernatant, re-suspend cells in PBS.
centrifuge at 1000 rpm for 5 min at room temperature to pellet the cells.

title: **Isolation of genomic DNA**
body:
The genomic DNA is extracted with MicroElute Genomic DNA Kit \(Omega) following to the manufacturer’s instruction.


1 . Re-suspend the sample cell pellet volume to with100ul with PBS Buffer.

body.body: Add 20 ul of Protease solution and mix well by vortexing.
Add 120 ul Buffer BL and vortex to mix. Incubate at 70℃ for 10 minutes. If the cells are too few, 4 ul of Linear acrylamide is recommended to be added to each sample.
Add 120 ul absolute ethanol and mix thoroughly by vortexing for 15s at maxi speed. Bring down any liquid drop from inside of lid by brief centrifugation.

body.body: into the column, including any precipitate that may have formed. Close the lid and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 1 min to bind DNA. Discard the collection tube and flow-through liquid.

Place the column into a new collection tube \(supplied). Add 500 ul of Buffer HB in the column. Close the lid and centrifuge at 8000 x g for 1 minute. Discard the flow-through and re-use collection tube.

Place the column into the same 2 ml tube \(supplied) and wash by pipetting 650 ul of DNAWash Buffer diluted with ethanol. Centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 1 min. Again, dispose of collection tube and flow-through liquid.
  Note: DNA Wash Buffer Concentrate must be diluted with absolute ethanol before use. Refer to label on bottle for directions or on Page 3 for preparation.
Using a new collection tube, wash the column with a second 650 ul of DNA Wash Buffer diluted with ethanol and centrifuge as above. Discard flow-through and re-use the collection tube.

Place the column into a sterile 1.5 ml microfuge tube and add 10-50 ul of preheated \(70℃) Elution Buffer or water onto the center of the membrane.
  Allow tubes to sit for 3 min at room temperature.

To elute DNA from the column, centrifuge at 20,000 x g for 1 min.
  Note: Incubation at 70oC rather than at room temperature will give a modest increase in DNAyield per elution. Alternatively the second elution may be performed using the first eluate or using the second 10-50ìl of preheated Elution Buffer or water.
The DNA concentration is measured with NanoDrop.

title: **Primary PCR amplification**
body: Work on ice unless stated otherwise.

body.body: If desired, normalize samples to a consistent concentration\(concentration \(100 ng/ul ) in a sterile 1.5 ml microfuge tube.
Vortex samples to mix and spin-down in a centrifuge.
Thaw the Phusion® High-Fidelity DNA Polymerase kit reagents. Remember to vortex and centrifuge the plate\(s) and reagents \(when thawed) before using them.

Make a 1 x Phusion® PCR master mix using the following recipe \(see attachment):
  10 µl 5x HF buffer


4 µl 2.5 mM dNTPs


0.5 µl Phusion® High-Fidelity DNA Polymerase


2.5 µl forward primer \(10 µM)


2.5 µl reverse primer \(10 µM).


29.5 µl Nuclease-free water
Add 1 ul DNA template\(100 ng/ul) to the PCR mix, mix and spin down.

Run the following PCR protocol on the PCR machine. Typically, this should be run for 25 cycles and stopped at the end of the final extension phase.
  Cycling Conditions:


98°C – 30 seconds


25-35 cycles of:


98°C – 10 seconds


55°C – 20 seconds


72°C – 10 minutes


Hold at 4°C


TROUBLESHOOTING: Samples that amplify poorly can be amplified with increased cycle numbers. Tm temperatures can be different from each pair of primers. It is recommended that to include a water blank be run to allow assessment of to exclude potential contamination in reagents.
Run 5 ul of PCR product on agrose gel to balance normalize the yield of every each fragments of the same sample.
Balance Pool different the fragments from one sample according to results from Step 7in a 1.5 ml microfuge tube according to the brightness on the agrose gel.
Bring the AMPure XP beads to room temperature.
Vortex the AMPure XP beads for 30 seconds to make sure that the beads are evenly dispersed. Add an equal volume of beads with the PCR product to the 1.5 ml microfuge tube.
Gently pipette entire volume up and down 10 times.
Incubate at room temperature without shaking for 5 minutes.
Place 1.5 ml microfuge tube on a magnetic stand for 2 minutes or until the supernatant has cleared.
With 1.5 ml microfuge tube on the magnetic stand, use a pipette to remove and discard the supernatant. Change tips between samples.
With 1.5 ml microfuge tube on the magnetic stand, wash the beads with freshly prepared 80% ethanol
With 1.5 ml microfuge tube on the magnetic stand, perform a second ethanol wash.
With 1.5 ml microfuge tube still on the magnetic stand, allow the beads to air-dry for 10 minutes.
Remove 1.5 ml microfuge tube from the magnetic stand. add 25 μl of ddH2O to each well of the Amplicon PCR plate.
Gently pipette mix up and down 10 times, changing tips after each column .
Incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes.

Place 1.5 ml microfuge tube on the magnetic stand for 2 minutes or until the supernatant has cleared. Using a multichannel pipette, carefully transfer 20 μl of the supernatant from 1.5 ml microfuge tube to a new one.
Determine an i5 and i7 dual-indexing scheme to, ensureing no index overlap conflicts between samples to be pooled for sequencing .
Thaw the Phusion® High-Fidelity DNA Polymerase \(New England Biolab, MA) kit reagents. Remember to vortex and centrifuge reagents \(when thawed) before using them.

Make a 1 x Phusion® PCR master mix using the following recipe \(see Table 1 for list of marker-gene primer sequences):
  10 µl 5x HF buffer


4 µl 2.5 mM dNTPs


0.5 µl Phusion® High-Fidelity DNA Polymerase


2.5 µl forward primer \(10 µM)


2.5 µl reverse primer \(10 µM).


25.5 µl Nuclease-free water


Add 5 ul template\(100 ng/ul) to the PCR mix.

Run the following PCR protocol on the BioRad Tetrad \(or equivalent PCR machine). Typically, this should be run for 5 cycles and stopped at the end of the final extension phase.
  Cycling Conditions:


98°C – 30 seconds


5 cycles of:


98°C – 10 seconds


55°C – 20 seconds


72°C – 10 minutes


Hold at 4°C
Run 5 ul of PCR product on agrose gel to balance every same sample.
Balance the samples in a 1.5 ml microfuge tube according to the brightness on the agrose gel.
